column4: Newbie question: Hi, can someone explaine the Ubuntu/Linux directory structure? I am used to windows and everything installing in C:\Program Files - is there an equivilant in Linux?
that was the most alien thing about linux when I started using it. There should be references about this online
programs  in /usr/bin   libraries in /usr/lib,  configuration files in /etc, temp files in /tmp,  all your personal config and data files in /home/user
- thanks! I also just did a search for file structure differences.
